intro: Solanum microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate, ovate leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are followed by berries that mature to a dark purple color. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
